item.title: Terry add a quote by Thomas Jefferson
item.description: "I cannot live without books." -- Thomas Jefferson

item.title: Terry add a quote by Cicero
item.description: "If you have a garden and a library, you have everything you need." -- Cicero

item.title: Terry add a quote by Margaret Mead
item.description: "Never doubt that a small group of thoughtful, committed, citizens can change the world. Indeed, it is the only thing that ever has." -- Margaret Mead

item.title: Terry add a quote by Maya Angelou
item.description: "Any book that helps a child to form a habit of reading, to make reading one of his deep and continuing needs, is good for him." -- Maya Angelou

item.title: Terry add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "When the Day of Judgment dawns and people, great and small, come marching in to receive their heavenly rewards, the Almighty will gaze upon the mere bookworms and say to Peter, â€œLook, these need no reward. We have nothing to give them. They have loved reading." -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: Terry add a quote by George Carlin
item.description: "Those who dance are considered insane by those who cannot hear the music." -- George Carlin

item.title: Terry add a quote by Friedrich Wilhelm Nietzsche
item.description: "We should consider every day lost on which we have not danced at least once." -- Friedrich Wilhelm Nietzsche
